parse_request_response(service, reqresp, response_body_type='', state='', **kwargs)¶

Deal with a self.http response. The response are expected to follow a special pattern, having the attributes:

  • headers (list of tuples with headers attributes and their values)

  • status_code (integer)

  • text (The text version of the response)

  • url (The calling URL)

Parameters

  • service – A oidcrp.service.Service instance

  • reqresp – The HTTP request response

  • response_body_type – If response in body one of ‘json’, ‘jwt’ or ‘urlencoded’

  • state – Session identifier

  • kwargs – Extra keyword arguments

Returns

service_request(service: oidcmsg.client.service.Service, url: str, method: Optional[str] = 'GET', body: Optional[dict] = None, response_body_type: Optional[str] = '', headers: Optional[dict] = None, **kwargs) → oidcmsg.message.Message¶

The method that sends the request and handles the response returned. This assumes that the response arrives in the HTTP response.

Parameters

  • service – The Service instance

  • url – The URL to which the request should be sent

  • method – Which HTTP method to use

  • body – A message body if any

  • response_body_type – The expected format of the body of the return message

  • httpc_params – Arguments for the HTTP client

Returns

A cls or ResponseMessage instance or the HTTP response instance if no response body was expected.
